Package se.oidc.nimbus.claims

Class ScopeConstants

java.lang.Object
se.oidc.nimbus.claims.ScopeConstants
public class ScopeConstants extends Object
Constants for the scopes defined in Claims and Scopes Specification for the Swedish OpenID Connect Profile.
Author:
Martin Lindström

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final OidcScopeValue
    NATURAL_PERSON_INFO
    A scope that defines a claim set that provides basic natural person information normally associated with a Swedish eID.
    static final OidcScopeValue
    NATURAL_PERSON_ORGANIZATIONAL_IDENTITY
    The “Natural Person Organizational Identity” scope requests basic organizational identity information claims about a person.
    static final OidcScopeValue
    NATURAL_PERSON_PERSONAL_NUMBER
    A scope that requests a Swedish civic registration number (personnummer) or a Swedish coordination number (samordningsnummer).
    static final OidcScopeValue
    SIGN
    The scope has two purposes; it indicates for the OpenID Provider that the request in which the scope is included is a "signature request" and requests claims.

  • Method Summary

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • NATURAL_PERSON_INFO

      public static final OidcScopeValue NATURAL_PERSON_INFO
      A scope that defines a claim set that provides basic natural person information normally associated with a Swedish eID.

    • NATURAL_PERSON_PERSONAL_NUMBER

      public static final OidcScopeValue NATURAL_PERSON_PERSONAL_NUMBER
      A scope that requests a Swedish civic registration number (personnummer) or a Swedish coordination number (samordningsnummer). These identity numbers are often used as primary identities at public Swedish organizations.

    • NATURAL_PERSON_ORGANIZATIONAL_IDENTITY

      public static final OidcScopeValue NATURAL_PERSON_ORGANIZATIONAL_IDENTITY
      The “Natural Person Organizational Identity” scope requests basic organizational identity information claims about a person. The organizational identity does not imply that the subject has any particular relationship with or standing within the organization, but rather that this identity has been issued/provided by that organization for any particular reason (employee, customer, consultant, etc.).

    • SIGN

      public static final OidcScopeValue SIGN
      The scope has two purposes; it indicates for the OpenID Provider that the request in which the scope is included is a "signature request" and requests claims.
